s'accrocher: be at loggerheads with each other
accrocher [qqn]: give [sb] a run for his/her/their money
avancer: help [sb] to get on more quickly
chanter: warm the cockles of your heart
coucher: coucher pour réussir : sleep your way to the top
se décider à faire [qch]: make your mind up to do [sth]
décourager [qqn] de faire [qch]: make [sb] not want to bother with [sth]
make [sb] think [sth] is not worth the bother
dégager: dégager les oreilles : cut it short around the ears
descendre: come down off your high horse
se devoir [qch]: have a duty to + [vtr/vi + prep] each other/one another
différer sur: be at variance with each other on
s'écouter: be attentive to your own needs
s'éloigner: get some distance between you and [sth]
estimer: have a great deal of respect for
s'éviter: stay out of each other's way
exagérer: make a song and dance about it
se gâter: take a turn for the worse
hésiter à faire [qch]: be undecided over/about whether to do [sth]
not be sure whether to do [sth]
hésiter entre [qch] et [qch]: be unable to decide between [sth] and [sth]
jouer de [qch]: jouer des coudes : elbow your way
se louer de faire [qch]: be proud of yourself for doing [sth]
be pleased with yourself for doing [sth]
mesurer: be X by X by X (in dimension/in size)
payer: be money to be made in [sth]
se pénétrer de [qch]: allow yourself to be filled with [sth]
se permettre de faire [qch]: have the brass neck to do [sth]
pleurer pour: throw a hissy fit to do [sth]
throw a hissy fit over doing [sth]
pouvoir: would you be so kind as to
préférer [qch] à autre chose: have a preference for [sth] over [sth] else
se promettre de faire [qch]: promise yourself that you will do [sth]
ne pas se rater: really make a mess of yourself
make a real mess of yourself
reconnaître: get the lay of the land
réfléchir: turn things over in your head
se sortir de [qch]: come out the other side of [sth]
se suffire à soi-même: stand on your own two feet
se tuer à faire [qch]: keep doing [sth] till you are blue in the face
do [sth] till you are blue in the face
tutoyer: be on first name terms with [sth]
se venger de [qch]: get your own back on [sb] for [sth]
